title: Understanding Gravity

questions.question_text: What is gravity?
options: A force that pulls objects toward each other
A force that pushes objects apart
questions.correct_answer: A force that pulls objects toward each other

questions.question_text: Which scientist is most famously associated with the theory of gravity?
According to Einstein's theory of General Relativity, what causes gravity?
options: Mass creates ripples in space and time
questions.correct_answer: Mass creates ripples in space and time

questions.question_text: If you drop a heavy object and a light object on the Moon (where there's no air), which hits the ground first?
options: They hit at the same time
questions.correct_answer: They hit at the same time

description: Test your current understanding of gravity — from basic observations to deeper concepts.

title: Understanding Gravity

questions.question_text: What is gravity?
options: A force that pushes objects apart
A force that pulls objects toward each other
questions.correct_answer: A force that pulls objects toward each other

questions.question_text: Who is credited with developing the law of universal gravitation?
How does the strength of gravity change as distance between two objects increases?
Which planet has the strongest gravitational pull in our solar system?
What happens to your mass and weight if you go to the Moon?
options: Mass changes, weight stays the same
Both mass and weight stay the same
Mass stays the same, weight decreases
questions.correct_answer: Mass stays the same, weight decreases

questions.question_text: According to Einstein's theory of general relativity, what causes gravity?
options: The bending of spacetime by mass and energy
questions.correct_answer: The bending of spacetime by mass and energy

questions.question_text: Why do astronauts float in space?
options: Because there is no gravity in space
Because they are far enough from Earth to escape gravity
Because they are in freefall around Earth
questions.correct_answer: Because they are in freefall around Earth

questions.question_text: What two factors determine the gravitational force between two objects?
If Earth's mass suddenly doubled, what would happen to the gravitational force between Earth and the Moon?
Which of these is NOT an effect of Earth's gravity?

description: Test your knowledge on the fundamental concepts of gravity, from basic ideas to real-world applications.

questions.question_text: go

title: Solar System Quiz

questions.question_text: Which planet is known as the 'Red Planet'?
What is the largest planet in our solar system?
Which planet has the most extensive ring system?
How many natural satellites (moons) does Earth have?
Which of these is NOT a gas giant?
What is the name of the dwarf planet located in the asteroid belt?
Which planet rotates on its side, with an axial tilt of about 98 degrees?
What is the closest star to our solar system?
Which moon is known for having a subsurface ocean and is a prime candidate for potential life?
What is the name of the region beyond Neptune that contains many icy bodies and dwarf planets?

description: Test your knowledge of the planets, moons, and features of our solar system.

title: Plankton Knowledge Quiz

questions.question_text: What does the term 'plankton' primarily refer to?
options: Organisms that drift with ocean currents
questions.correct_answer: Organisms that drift with ocean currents

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a major role of phytoplankton in marine ecosystems?
What is the primary energy source for phytoplankton?
Which of these is an example of zooplankton?
How do zooplankton typically obtain their energy?
options: Consuming phytoplankton or other small organisms
questions.correct_answer: Consuming phytoplankton or other small organisms

questions.question_text: What environmental factor is most critical for phytoplankton blooms?
Which gas do phytoplankton contribute significantly to producing?
What is the base of the marine food web?

description: Test your understanding of plankton types, roles, and ecological importance.

description: Test your knowledge of essential Japanese words.

questions.question_text: What does 'Guten Tag' mean in English?
